section.para: A Shipping Guarantee (SG) is an undertaking by a bank to the shipping owner or agent of a vessel, to release goods to the importer pending receipt of the original Bill of Lading. This helps the importer to clear the purchased goods under a Letter of Credit or a simple documentary collection while waiting for shipping documents to be presented. Hence it can for instance save the client from storage charges levied by the port authorities due to late arrival of the shipping documents or delays in clearance of the goods. Some Letters of Indemnity could also be handled through this module.

The module of enables you, on behalf of your company (which is the importer and applicant) to initiate new Shipping Guarantee requests, send them to your chosen Issuing Bank, and subsequently follow up these transactions by sending and receiving updates on the records to and from the bank.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "SG" and "Shipping Guarantee" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Shipping Guarantee - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Shipping Guarantee function, from the toolbar, select Trade Services > Shipping Guarantee.

section.title: Shipping Guarantee Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions. All are basically as described in the chapter Functions, but SG Initiate and Update SG differ in some ways from the Initiate and Amendment described in that chapter. There is no Message to Bank - you use Update SG to send a free-format message to the bank.

listitem.para: Enter the details of a new Shipping Guarantee, optionally linking it to an existing Letter of Credit, and submit them to the Issuing Bank of your choice.
Update the details of an existing Shipping Guarantee or trigger the guarantee redemption, and submit it to the Issuing Bank.
View all existing Shipping Guarantee records, that are not yet complete..
Display lists of existing Shipping Guarantee records, according to specific search criteria.
Maintain Unsigned, Purged and Rejected SGs

section.title: Shipping Guarantee - SG Initiation
section.para: This section describes the SG Initiation part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: SG Initiation Options
section.para:
This part of the menu contains several options, providing different ways to request a Shipping Guarantee.
From Scratch
Create a new Shipping Guarantee from scratch.
From Existing LC
Create a new Shipping Guarantee using an existing Letter of Credit as a base.
Copy from SG
Create a new Shipping Guarantee using an existing one as a base.
Edit Transactions
Review, complete and submit Shipping Guarantee records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit Shipping Guarantee records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: SG Initiation - From Existing LC
section.para: Create a Shipping Guarantee request from an existing Letter of Credit. This option displays a list of your company's existing Letters of Credit, to select from as a base for the finance request. This list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Bank Reference, Beneficiary or Currency field.

This option is useful when the relevant Bill of Lading or any other such document as described in the terms of the underlying Letter of Credit is not yet available for production to the Shipping Company.

The columns returned in the list of existing Letter of Credit transactions, are the following:
Field
Description

Bank Ref.
The type of record. (New, etc.)
Beneficiary
The Beneficiary of the LC.
CCY
The Currency of the LC.
Amount

Click in the System Id column to open a new Shipping Guarantee form, populated with the details from the selected Letter of Credit. Some of the information for the transaction is defaulted, including the Issuing Bank name, the currency and the amount of the underlying Letter of Credit. A link is created between this guarantee application and the original LC, hence improving the reporting and inquiry features available.

section.para: Create a Shipping Guarantee request from a previously created Shipping Guarantee. This option displays a list of the previously submitted and approved Shipping Guarantees, to select from as a base for a new one.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are the System ID, Entity, Bank Reference, Beneficiary or Ccy fields. The list is not displayed until search criteria has been entered and the Search button has been clicked. This option is useful when the relevant Bill of Lading or any other such document as described in the terms of the underlying Letter of Credit is not yet available for production to the Shipping Company.

section.title: SG Initiation - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows Shipping Guarantee records that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Shipping Guarantee records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: SG Initiation - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows a Shipping Guarantee record that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Shipping Guarantee records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the record in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Update SG
section.para: This section describes the Update SG part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: Update SG Options
section.para: This part of the menu contains several options, providing different ways to send and maintain update messages regarding an existing Shipping Guarantee to the Issuing Bank.

A typical use of this function could be to ask the Issuing Bank to change the original amount of the Shipping Guarantee or to indicate that it can be cancelled while uploading the appropriate redemption letter.
From Existing SG
Update and send a message to the bank from an existing Shipping Guarantee.
Action Required
Review and request action from customers for SG records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Edit Transactions
Review, complete and submit updated Shipping Guarantee records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit updated Shipping Guarantee records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Update SG - From Existing SG
section.para: When this option is selected an update message can be created from a Shipping Guarantee that you or another user at your company have previously requested and whose initiation has already been acknowledged by the bank.

This function displays a list of existing Shipping Guarantees - that is, Shipping Guarantee requests that have been acknowledged by the Issuing Bank. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Bank Reference, Beneficiary or Currency fields.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: SG Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Shipping Guarantee records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: SG Maintenance - Options
section.para: The SG Maintenance function allows access to the SG Maintenance options through links in the left side navigation menu.
The following options are available for SG Maintenance:

listitem.para: Associate an entity with the SG.
Associate a reference with the SG.
List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) SG transactions.
List and optionally delete SG transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team.
List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

section.title: SG Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: List all Shipping Guarantees and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now associate an entity for the SG by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: SG Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to a SG record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: SG Maintenance - Unsigned SGs
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) Shipping Guarantee transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: SG Maintenance - Purged SGs
section.para: List and optionally delete Shipping Guarantee transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: SG Maintenance - Rejected SGs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of Shipping Guarantee records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
